questions.question: This is the 6th time, you ………………………. the same question.
questions.description: The present perfect is used after this is the first /second/last etc.

questions.question: I ………………………. a strange experience yesterday.
questions.description: Use the simple past to say that something happened sometime ago.

questions.question: As soon as she saw me, she …………………….. towards me.
Those who are against this proposal …………………………. their hand.
questions.description: Rise is intransitive raise is transitive.

questions.question: She asked if I ………………………… her cat.
questions.description: Present perfect in the direct speech becomes past perfect in the indirect speech.

questions.question: Although I had all the qualifications, my application …………………………….
questions.description: Use the passive form here because the subject is not the doer.

questions.question: Despite her best efforts, she …………………………… pass the test.
He said he regretted that he ………………………. so hastily.
He …………………………… for incompetence.
questions.description: A passive verb is required here because the subject is not the doer of the action.

questions.question: He was clever but he …………………………. industry.
As they were poor, they …………………………. great hardship.
questions.description: When one verb is in the past tense, the other verbs too will most probably be in the past tense.

questions.question: I conceded to his request because I ………………………….. to disappoint him.
